member.name: T:Fast.UAParser.IUAParserOutput
member.summary: Representing the parse results. Structure of this class aligns with the ua-parser-output WebIDL structure defined in this document: https://github.com/ua-parser/uap-core/blob/master/docs/specification.md

member.summary: The Device parsed from the user agent string

member.summary: The User Agent parsed from the user agent string

member.name: T:Fast.UAParser.MinimalYamlParser
member.summary: Just enough string parsing to recognize the regexes.yaml file format. Introduced to remove dependency on large Yaml parsing lib. Note that a unittest ensures compatibility by ensuring regexes and properties are read similar to using the full yaml lib

member.name: T:Fast.UAParser.Parser
member.summary: Represents a parser of a user agent string

member.name: F:Fast.UAParser.Parser.Other
member.summary: The constant string value used to signal an unknown match for a given property or value. This is by default the string "Other".

member.name: M:Fast.UAParser.Parser.FromYaml(System.String,Fast.UAParser.ParserOptions)
member.summary: Returns a instance based on the regex definitions in a yaml string
member.param: a string containing yaml definitions of reg-ex
specifies the options for the parser
member.returns: A instance parsing user agent strings based on the regexes defined in the yaml string

member.name: M:Fast.UAParser.Parser.GetDefault(Fast.UAParser.ParserOptions)
member.summary: Returns a instance based on the embedded regex definitions. The embedded regex definitions may be outdated. Consider passing in external yaml definitions using
member.param: specifies the options for the parser

member.name: M:Fast.UAParser.Parser.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a user agent string and obtain all client information

member.name: M:Fast.UAParser.Parser.ParseOS(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a user agent string and obtain the OS information

member.name: M:Fast.UAParser.Parser.ParseDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a user agent string and obtain the device information

member.name: M:Fast.UAParser.Parser.ParseUserAgent(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a user agent string and obtain the UserAgent information

member.name: T:Fast.UAParser.ParserOptions
member.summary: Options available for the parser

member.name: P:Fast.UAParser.ParserOptions.UseCompiledRegex
member.summary: If true, will use compiled regular expressions for slower startup time but higher throughput. The default is false.

member.name: P:Fast.UAParser.ParserOptions.MatchTimeOut
member.summary: Allows for specifying the maximum time spent on regular expressions, serving as a fail safe for potential infinite backtracking. The default is set to Regex.InfiniteMatchTimeout
